## GAD-7 vs SWLS

When comparing psychological instruments like the Generalised Anxiety Disorder 7-item (GAD-7) and the Satisfaction With Life Scale (SWLS), the traditional process requires researchers to manually go through each questionnaire item, line by line. This method is not only time-consuming, but can also be subjective. This is where Harmony steps in. Harmony is an advanced software tool developed for psychologists that leverages the power of AI to achieve questionnaire harmonisation, like the GAD-7 vs SWLS, in a much more efficient and objective manner. Utilizing natural language processing and generative AI models, Harmony can give a percentage match between each item in the GAD-7 and SWLS. It has the capability to handle items even in multiple languages, thus opening up possibilities of cross-study and cross-cultural research. If you're looking into researching the nuances and differences of GAD-7 vs SWLS, Harmony provides an intuitive, user-friendly platform to facilitate your work. The GAD-7 and SWLS hold important roles in psychological and social psychology studies. The GAD-7 measures the severity of generalised anxiety disorder, while the SWLS assesses one's satisfaction with life. Both these instruments provide valuable insights into human mental health. Optimizing the process of comparing such instruments, like the GAD-7 vs SWLS, with Harmony not only saves valuable research time, but also ensures the objectivity and reliability of the comparison. Why not give Harmony a try in your next research comparison project?

## Compare the items in GAD-7 English and SWLS

* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import GAD-7 and SWLS into Harmony and harmonise them</a> - find similarities between the two instruments using our AI platform
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just GAD-7 into Harmony</a> - compare GAD-7 English with other instruments
* <a href="https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app/#" target="harmonyapp">Import just SWLS into Harmony</a> - compare SWLS with other instruments


## Questions in GAD-7

|   No. | GAD-7 English                                                                                                                                      |
|------:|:---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|     1 | Feeling nervous, anxious, or on edge                                                                                                               |
|     2 | Not being able to stop or control worrying                                                                                                         |
|     3 | Worrying too much about different things                                                                                                           |
|     4 | Trouble relaxing                                                                                                                                   |
|     5 | Being so restless that it is hard to sit still                                                                                                     |
|     6 | Becoming easily annoyed or irritable                                                                                                               |
|     7 | Feeling afraid, as if something awful might happen                                                                                                 |
|     8 | If you checked any problems, how difficult have they made it for you to do your work, take care of things at home, or get along with other people? |
